<<<<<<< HEAD
The third dayes creation. By that most excellent, learned, and diuine poet, VVilliam, Lord Bartas. Done verse for verse out of the originall French by Thomas VVinter, Master of Arts Sepmaine. Day 3. English Du Bartas, Guillaume de Salluste, seigneur, 1544-1590. Winter, Thomas, Master of Arts.
[12], 36 p.
Printed [by R. Field] for Thomas Clerke, London : 1604.
A translation of the third day of: Sepmaine. In verse. Printer's name from STC. Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
=======

[12], 36 p.
Printed [by R. Field] for Thomas Clerke, London : 1604.
A translation of the third day of: Sepmaine. In verse. Printer's name from STC. Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
